event: Island originally inhabited by Ciboney peoples, later by Arawaks and then Caribs (Kalinago).
Christopher Columbus sights Saint Vincent on January 22 during his third voyage.
Island inhabited by Garifuna (Black Caribs), descendants of Caribs and shipwrecked Africans.
First French settlers establish plantations despite resistance from the Garifuna.
Treaty of Paris cedes Saint Vincent to Britain for the first time.
France captures the island during the American Revolutionary War.
Treaty of Versailles returns the island to British control.
First Carib War – Garifuna resist British colonization with French support.
Second Carib War ends with British victory; Garifuna exiled to Honduras.
Slavery abolished in the British Empire; former enslaved population emancipated.
Saint Vincent becomes a British Crown Colony.
Becomes an associated state with internal self-government.
Saint Vincent and the Grenadines gains full independence from the UK on October 27.
Ralph Gonsalves becomes Prime Minister; begins long tenure in office.
Referendum to adopt a republican constitution fails to pass.
La Soufrière volcano erupts, displacing thousands and causing widespread damage.
COVID-19 pandemic impacts economy and healthcare system.
